name.text: Big Night Nashville New Year's Eve 2018-19
name.html: Big Night Nashville New Year's Eve 2018-19

description.text:
Something big is brewing in Nashville on New Year's Eve.  The countdown to 2019 is on and Big Night Nashville will be at the unforgettable Gaylord Opryland Resort. Big Night Nashville is going to be even bigger and better this year!
This Spectacular Event Features:

Tickets include drinks*, food and entertainment (specific to ticket type)
Multiple, Themed Party Areas - moving into bigger ballrooms and more ballroom!
Multiple Dance Floors!
World-Class DJ Lineup
Incredible Party Band Lineup
First Class Cuisine
Huge Midnight Celebration
Party Favors For All
Much, much more!

Date: Monday, December 31, 2018Time: 9:00 pm - 2:00 am
More details can be found at: www.bignightnashville.com
Sponsors, groups (10 or more) or custom orders: contactus@bignightnashville.com
*Tennessee  law limits the number of drinks served in an inclusive package. Guests will be provided with ten (10) drink tickets upon NYE registration. 
*You must be at least 21 years of age to enter the event. No one under 21 will be admitted so please do not buy tickets as there are no refunds. You must bring a valid ID with photo. Without a picture ID to show proof of being legal age, no entry, no exceptions.
* All sales are final. No refunds.
* Ticket sales do not include your hotel rooms. Hotel room sales are handled through the hotel reservations department. Click here to reserve your hotel room
* Items subject to change and prices will increase as the event nears.
* We enforce responsible alcohol service any person deemed intoxicated beyond legal limits will be asked to leave the event with efforts made for a “safe ride”.

name.text: Maximizing the Impact of New Opportunity Zones
name.html: Maximizing the Impact of New Opportunity Zones

description.text:
Background: Opportunity Zones are a new community development tool established by Congress in the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act of 2017. This new tool is designed to drive long-term capital to low-income communities. The new law provides a federal tax incentive for investors to re-invest their capital gains into Opportunity Funds, which are specialized vehicles dedicated to investing in designated low-income areas. There are 176 census tracts in Tennessee that are qualified opportunity zones. These low-income tracts were nominated by Tennessee and certified by the Secretary of the Treasury. Tennessee’s 176 tract recommendations were determined based on a strategic and data-driven review of county mayor feedback in addition to consideration of state priorities and initiatives including:

Business development and brownfield redevelopment opportunities
Retail, commercial and tourism development opportunities
Community and rural development initiatives
Low-income housing development opportunities
Proximity to entrepreneur centers, technology transfer offices, and colleges and universities

Come join a regional conversation as we discuss current regulations for zones and funds and best practices for taking advantage of the program, based in part on the successes and failures of past 'zone' initiatives.
Speaker(s): Frost Brown Todd, LLC and Lattimore, Black, Morgan and Cain (LBMC). 
Who Should Attend

Attorneys
Accountants
Bank & Credit Unions
Investors
Developers
Other professionals involved in commercial real estate transactions
Entrepreneurs
Financial advisors
Wealth managers
Community partners
City planners
Housing Authorities
Foundations
Elected Officials

Co-Sponsor(s): State of Tennessee Economic & Community Development; Tennessee State University - College of Business; Nashville Area Chamber of Commerce; Greater Nashville Regional Council; Tennessee Chamber of Commerce; Tennessee Bankers Association; Tennessee Credit Union League; Tennessee Housing Development Agency, 
Community Partners: The Equity Alliance; Walk Bike Nashville; Nashville Black Chamber of Commerce

description.text:
DESCRIPTION



Join Muddy Roots Music and the Tennessee Central Railway Museum on a day trip to Del Monaco Winery in Baxter, TN. Take an excursion train ride in a restored classic 1950s-era American streamlined stainless steel passenger train! Each ticket includes a wine tasting on board the train, winery tours, winery activities, live music, and more wine tasting! Passengers will have the opportunity to purchase wine and lunch at the winery and each ticket includes a souvenir wine glass! Vintage dress is encourged but not required. Just have fun with it.
Seats are reserved and will be assigned by order of purchase with a follow up email 14 days from event. Passengers will be allowed to move around the train, but if you would like your group to sit together please purchase your tickets together and on the same card.  Seats on train may face each other which puts you in a social scenario with other attendees.REFRESHMENTS & SOUVENIRSSouvenirs are available for purchase. Refreshments are available for purchase in the diner car. Vintage inspired attendants will serve you complimentary breakfast biscuits, artisan pastries, snacks and drinks.
GROUP SALESFor groups of 16 or more, please contact us at wineontherails@gmail.comTIMES
Boarding: 7:30am at Tennessee Central Railway MuseumDeparture: 8:00am SHARP to Del Monaco Winery in Baxter, TNReturn: Approximately 6:00pm at Tennessee Central Railway MuseumPlease arrive at the station by 7:00am.
TENNESSEE CENTRAL RAILWAY MUSEUM220 Willow St, Nashville TN 37210
CLASSIC TOUR CAREnjoy a ride through the serene countryside with friends and loved ones. Comfortable coach accommodations, featuring spacious, reclining seats with windows up to 5 feet wide on both sides of the car. The perfect getaway. 
RITZ PARTY CARA rolling party for the livelier groups. Comfortable coach accommodations, featuring spacious, reclining seats with windows up to 5 feet wide on both sides of the car. 
DOME SEATINGThe ultimate panoramic view from the train is from the 20 seats in the ex-Northern Pacific Ry Dome coach car. Ride in spacious, cushioned seats in a glass-enclosed dome above the roofline from the rest of the train to experience unobstructed 360-degree views of the beautiful Tennessee countryside.  Personal attendant comes through to assist.  Only 20 seats are available, so make your reservations extra early, as these seats always sell out first! 
Passengers in wheelchairs, please contact Terry Bebout at the Tennessee Central Railway Museum ticket office for special arrangements. 615-244-9001 x4 or email tbebout@nerr.com
TERMS & CONDITIONS
***No refunds for any reason.*** Tickets are transferrable to other people, but not to other events. Must be 21 years old or older to ride the train.
Diner car is available on train once rolling. The winery brings in a food truck as well.Wine on the Rails FAQs https://wineontherails.com/faqs/Wine on the Rails is a Muddy Roots Music event affiliated company. We are not staffed or affiliated by the Tennessee Central Railway Museum or the DelMonaco Winery. For specific questions regarding the Tenneessee Central Railway Museum, please contact or visit them at http://www.tcry.org/. For specific questions regarding the DelMonaco Winery, please contact them at https://www.delmonacowinery.com/contact or visit https://www.delmonacowinery.com/. 
***No refunds for any reason.***

DESCRIPTION

Join Muddy Roots Music and the Tennessee Central Railway Museum on a day trip to Del Monaco Winery in Baxter, TN. Take an excursion train ride in a restored classic 1950s-era American streamlined stainless steel passenger train! Each ticket includes a wine tasting on board the train, winery tours, winery activities, live music, and more wine tasting! Passengers will have the opportunity to purchase wine and lunch at the winery and each ticket includes a souvenir wine glass! Vintage dress is encourged but not required. Just have fun with it.

Passengers will be allowed to move around the train, but if you would like your group to sit together please purchase your tickets together and on the same card.  Seats on train may face each other which puts you in a social scenario with other attendees.

REFRESHMENTS & SOUVENIRS
Souvenirs are available for purchase. Refreshments are available for purchase in the diner car. Vintage inspired attendants will serve you complimentary breakfast biscuits, artisan pastries, snacks and drinks.

GROUP SALES
For groups of 16 or more, please contact us at wineontherails@gmail.com

TIMES

Boarding: 7:30am at Tennessee Central Railway Museum
Departure: 8:00am SHARP to Del Monaco Winery in Baxter, TN
Return: Approximately 6:00pm at Tennessee Central Railway Museum
Please arrive at the station by 7:00am.

TENNESSEE CENTRAL RAILWAY MUSEUM
220 Willow St, Nashville TN 37210

CLASSIC TOUR CAR
Enjoy a ride through the serene countryside with friends and loved ones. Comfortable coach accommodations, featuring spacious, reclining seats with windows up to 5 feet wide on both sides of the car. The perfect getaway.

RITZ PARTY CAR
A rolling party for the livelier groups. Comfortable coach accommodations, featuring spacious, reclining seats with windows up to 5 feet wide on both sides of the car. 

DOME SEATING
The ultimate panoramic view from the train is from the 20 seats in the ex-Northern Pacific Ry Dome coach car. Ride in spacious, cushioned seats in a glass-enclosed dome above the roofline from the rest of the train to experience unobstructed 360-degree views of the beautiful Tennessee countryside.  Personal attendant comes through to assist.  Only 20 seats are available, so make your reservations extra early, as these seats always sell out first! 

Passengers in wheelchairs, please contact Terry Bebout at the Tennessee Central Railway Museum ticket office for special arrangements. 615-244-9001 x4 or email tbebout@nerr.com


TERMS & CONDITIONS

***No refunds for any reason.*** Tickets are transferrable to other people, but not to other events. Must be 21 years old or older to ride the train.

Diner car is available on train once rolling. The winery brings in a food truck as well.

Wine on the Rails FAQs 
https://wineontherails.com/faqs/

Wine on the Rails is a Muddy Roots Music event affiliated company. We are not staffed or affiliated by the Tennessee Central Railway Museum or the DelMonaco Winery. For specific questions regarding the Tenneessee Central Railway Museum, please contact or visit them at http://www.tcry.org/. For specific questions regarding the DelMonaco Winery, please contact them at https://www.delmonacowinery.com/contact or visit https://www.delmonacowinery.com/. 

***No refunds for any reason.***

description.text:
CoffeeChamps is caffeine-packed weekend event, featuring the Qualifying Competitions for the U.S Coffee Championships. Coffee professionals from all over the United States compete to enhance and show off their skills as Baristas, Brewers, Roasters, and Tasters. New this year, the Coffee in Good Spirits event joins the schedule as well.  The champions from the U.S. Coffee Championships will represent the USA at the World Championships. CoffeeChamps also features a free cafe & roaster village, vendor marketplace, brewing demonstrations, and so much more! Come be a part of the action!
http://www.uscoffeechampionships.org
GENERAL EVENT INFORMATION:NASHVILLE, TENNESSEESat, January 12th - Sun, January 13th, 20199:00am - 6:30pm
 LOCATION:Track One1201 4th Ave SNashville, TN 37210
Track One Nashville
Find other SCA events here https://sca.coffee/events/  
HOST HOTEL:Holiday Inn Nashville-Vanderbilt2613 West End AveNashville, TN 37203Hotel Self-Parking $22 per nightReservations through Par Avion:https://book.passkey.com/go/Nashville2018
Toll-free 800-826-0143  |  Local 310-590-4711  Email: rescenter@paravion-inc.com
CALLING ALL VOLUNTEERS:
Volunteers make the world go round & we can’t put on the awesome CoffeeChamps events without them. Everyone from your best friend, your co-worker, and your mom are all welcome and encouraged to volunteer! Know someone that wants to get even more involved? Have them fill out the Lead Volunteer application!
Volunteer signups: http://www.uscoffeechampionships.org/volunteer/
PLUS  Volunteers who work 1 or more shifts will receive a free pass to attend CoffeeChamps.
WEAPONS & CONCEALED HANDGUNS:
It is the policy of the Specialty Coffee Association no firearms or other weapons are ever allowed at SCA events, regardless of permits or zoning.  Please leave your weapons at home or you will be asked to leave the premises. 

FAQs
 Are there ID or minimum age requirements:

Attendees?      All ages are welcome to attend.
Competitors and Judges?   Must be 18 (21+ for Coffee in Good Spirits) or older to participate in competitions. Competitors must also hold a valid U.S. Passport or have twenty-four (24) months of documented employment or scholastic curriculum in the United States of America to participate.

      Additional information may be found in ticket descriptions.

What are my transportation/parking options for getting to and from the event?

Attendees: tbd parking information
Competitors:  tbd competitor parking information

 
How can I contact the organizer with any questions?
Competition questions can be directed to competitions@sca.coffee Sponsorship/Booth Sales questions can be directed to susang@sca.coffee
 
What's the refund policy?
Tickets are non-refundable and non-transferable.
Need more details?

COMPETITOR INFO:Need more competitor info?  You can find all the info you need on our website here  http://www.uscoffeechampionships.org/faqs/ or you may contact us at competitions@sca.coffee
CODE OF CONDUCT: We have a strong Code of Conduct at the Specialty Coffee Association which you can read here https://coffeeexpo.org/code-of-conduct As an attendee to the U.S. CoffeeChamps Event you will be required to agree to this code.

Purchase a Premium Ticket to Homecoming and receive a FREE 2019 IMPACT Calendar! *Premium sections are all floor seats.

Return: Approximately 6:00pm at Tennessee Central Railway Museum


Please arrive at the station by 7:00am.








TENNESSEE CENTRAL RAILWAY MUSEUM


220 Willow St, Nashville TN 37210








CLASSIC TOUR CAR


Enjoy a ride through the serene countryside with friends and loved ones. Comfortable coach accommodations, featuring spacious, reclining seats with windows up to 5 feet wide on both sides of the car. The perfect getaway. 





RITZ PARTY CAR


A rolling party for the livelier groups. Comfortable coach accommodations, featuring spacious, reclining seats with windows up to 5 feet wide on both sides of the car. 





DOME SEATING


The ultimate panoramic view from the train is from the 20 seats in the ex-Northern Pacific Ry Dome coach car. Ride in spacious, cushioned seats in a glass-enclosed dome above the roofline from the rest of the train to experience unobstructed 360-degree views of the beautiful Tennessee countryside. Personal attendant comes through to assist. Only 20 seats are available, so make your reservations extra early, as these seats always sell out first! 





Passengers in wheelchairs, please contact Terry Bebout at the Tennessee Central Railway Museum ticket office for special arrangements. 615-244-9001 x4 or email tbebout@nerr.com








TERMS & CONDITIONS





***No refunds for any reason.*** Tickets are transferrable to other people, but not to other events. Must be 21 years old or older to ride the train.





Diner car is available on train once rolling. The winery brings in a food truck as well.





Wine on the Rails FAQs 


https://wineontherails.com/faqs/





Wine on the Rails is a Muddy Roots Music event affiliated company. We are not staffed or affiliated by the Tennessee Central Railway Museum or the DelMonaco Winery. For specific questions regarding the Tenneessee Central Railway Museum, please contact or visit them at http://www.tcry.org/. For specific questions regarding the DelMonaco Winery, please contact them at https://www.delmonacowinery.com/contact or visit https://www.delmonacowinery.com/. 





***No refunds for any reason.***
description.html:
Take your loved on a romantic date aboard a vintage train to a winery or book a group party in the ritz car. Both options will provide you an upscale and very exclusive version of the wine train excursions.


Join Muddy Roots Music and the Tennessee Central Railway Museum on a day trip to Del Monaco Winery in Baxter, TN. Take an excursion train ride in a restored classic 1950s-era American streamlined stainless steel passenger train! Each ticket includes a wine tasting on board the train, winery tours, winery activities, live music, and more wine tasting! Passengers will have the opportunity to purchase wine and lunch at the winery and each ticket includes a souvenir wine glass! Vintage dress is encourged but not required. Just have fun with it.

Seats are reserved and will be assigned by order of purchase with a follow up email 14 days from event. Passengers will be allowed to move around the train, but if you would like your group to sit together please purchase your tickets together and on the same card. Seats on train may face each other which puts you in a social scenario with other attendees. *Please see our FAQ page on our website: https://wineontherails.com/faqs/.

REFRESHMENTS & SOUVENIRS
Souvenirs are available for purchase. Refreshments may be purchased in the diner car.

Vintage inspired attendants will serve you complimentary breakfast biscuits, artisan pastries, snacks and drinks.

GROUP SALES
For groups of 16 or more, please contact us at wineontherails@gmail.com

description.text:
Sing! ― A conference for pastors, musicians, and leaders to reform and encourage congregational singing August 19-21, Nashville TN.
Our theme for Sing! 2019 is The Life of Christ - building on the foundation of the Gospel story in all we sing and seeing how it shapes the church’s year.
This conference exists to help pastors, musicians, and leaders build a Biblical understanding and creative vision for the congregational singing in their churches. Bringing together speakers and artists from many traditions and walks of life, our desire is to encourage churches towards a deeper, more dynamic view of theology, artistry and mission in congregational singing. 
Speakers Include – Keith Getty, Kristyn Getty, John Piper, Joni Eareckson Tada, Conrad Mbewe, Os Guinness, Matt Merker, Matt Boswell, Matt Papa, Jordan Kauflin, Bob Kauflin, Fernado Ortega, and many more!
Once you've completed your registration, consider expanding your conference experience by joining the 2019 Sing! Choir.  Click here for more info.  
Hotel information is available.  Click here to book now.

description.text:
PLEASE BE OUR GUEST FOR A SPECIAL OPENING NIGHT EDUCATOR EVENT AT NCT! Tickets to the performance are free for each educator and a guest (you may reserve up to 2 tickets). Additional tickets may be purchased at the door at the door; $16 for adults and $8 for students. NCT also offers a reception and a professional development workshop for each event that explores the themes of the show and activities that educators can take back to their classrooms. The workshop qualifies for PD credit in many districts.
 2017-18 NCT EDUCATOR EVENTS 

Tuck Everlasting: September 13, 2018
Disney's The Little Mermaid: November 8, 2018
Ghost: January 17, 2019
The Very Hungry Caterpillar Show: February 21, 2019
Tomás  and The Library Lady: April 12, 2019

 2018-19 SEASON
TUCK EVERLASTING September 13-October 7, 2018Book by Claudia Shear and Tim FederleMusic by Chris MillerLyrics by Nathan Tysen"There are two ways down one long road. One clear path to two conclusions. Does the story end, or never end? Does the secret fade, or is it everlasting?"After adventuring beyond her white picket fence, “good girl” Winnie Foster meets the energetic teenager Jesse Tuck, who leads her on an unexpected, magical journey. Soon she is faced with an extraordinary question: If you could choose to live forever, would you? Based on the best-selling novel by Natalie Babbitt, this heartfelt Broadway musical is full of soaring melodies and mischief. Performed with a live orchestra!
 
DISNEY'S THE LITTLE MERMAID November 8-December 23, 2018Theatre for Young Audiences Regional Premiere AdaptationMusic by Alan MenkenLyrics by Howard Ashman and Glenn SlaterBook by Doug Wright
"If only I could make my father understand. I don’t see how a world that makes such wonderful thing could be so bad. "
In a kingdom beneath the sea, King Triton’s youngest daughter Ariel yearns to have her questions answered about the human world. When she saves the handsome Prince Eric from drowning, Ariel begins to discover her own voice with the help of her friends – even after the tricky sea witch silences her. Based on one of Hans Christian Andersen’s most beloved fairy tales, this classic will be given its own dose of NCT magic. Performed with a live orchestra!  
GHOST January 17-February 3, 2019World PremiereBy Idris GoodwinBased on the book Ghost by Jason ReynoldsOriginally published in 2016 by AthaneumUsed with the permission of Pippin Properties, Inc.
"Trouble is, you can’t run away from yourself."
Castle Crenshaw, a.k.a. Ghost, has been running his entire life, but for all the wrong reasons. Then one day he meets Coach, an Olympic medalist who sees his unique raw talent. Can Ghost achieve the speed he needs for success, or will his past finally catch up to him? A world premiere especially developed for Nashville Children’s Theatre.
  
THE VERY HUNGRY CATERPILLAR SHOWFebruary 21-April 7, 2019Created by Jonathan RockefellerBased on Eric Carle’s books
"One Sunday morning the warm sun cane up and – pop! – out of the egg came a tiny and very hungry caterpillar."
Direct from Off-Broadway, four beloved classics — “Brown Bear, Brown Bear”, “Mister Seahorse”, “The Very Lonely Firefly”, and “The Very Hungry Caterpillar” — leap off the page and on to the stage right in front of your eyes brought to life by a menagerie of 75 incredible puppets.
 
TOMÁS  AND THE LIBRARY LADYApril 25-May 19, 2019By José Cruz GonzálezAdapted from the book by Pat MoraThis production will be performed with sections of dialogue in Spanish and English with projected translations. "Libros, libros, libros I love to read. Libros, libros, libros that’s what I need."Based on the true story of Mexican-American author and educator Tomás Rivera, this play, told in both Spanish and English, follows the son of migrant farm workers as he discovers a surprising world of possibility inside his local library thanks to a special librarian. This inspirational, theatrical biography proves that reading and respect can make anything possible.

2018-19 SEASON

TUCK EVERLASTING
September 13-October 7, 2018
Book by Claudia Shear and Tim Federle
Music by Chris Miller
Lyrics by Nathan Tysen

"There are two ways down one long road. One clear path to two conclusions. Does the story end, or never end? Does the secret fade, or is it everlasting?"

After adventuring beyond her white picket fence, “good girl” Winnie Foster meets the energetic teenager Jesse Tuck, who leads her on an unexpected, magical journey. Soon she is faced with an extraordinary question: If you could choose to live forever, would you? Based on the best-selling novel by Natalie Babbitt, this heartfelt Broadway musical is full of soaring melodies and mischief. Performed with a live orchestra!

 

DISNEY'S THE LITTLE MERMAID
November 8-December 23, 2018
Theatre for Young Audiences Regional Premiere Adaptation
Music by Alan Menken
Lyrics by Howard Ashman and Glenn Slater
Book by Doug Wright

"If only I could make my father understand. I don’t see how a world that makes such wonderful thing could be so bad. "

In a kingdom beneath the sea, King Triton’s youngest daughter Ariel yearns to have her questions answered about the human world. When she saves the handsome Prince Eric from drowning, Ariel begins to discover her own voice with the help of her friends – even after the tricky sea witch silences her. Based on one of Hans Christian Andersen’s most beloved fairy tales, this classic will be given its own dose of NCT magic. Performed with a live orchestra!

GHOST
January 17-February 3, 2019
World Premiere
By Idris Goodwin
Based on the book Ghost by Jason Reynolds
Originally published in 2016 by Athaneum
Used with the permission of Pippin Properties, Inc.

"Trouble is, you can’t run away from yourself."

Castle Crenshaw, a.k.a. Ghost, has been running his entire life, but for all the wrong reasons. Then one day he meets Coach, an Olympic medalist who sees his unique raw talent. Can Ghost achieve the speed he needs for success, or will his past finally catch up to him? A world premiere especially developed for Nashville Children’s Theatre.

  

THE VERY HUNGRY CATERPILLAR SHOW
February 21-April 7, 2019
Created by Jonathan Rockefeller
Based on Eric Carle’s books

"One Sunday morning the warm sun cane up and – pop! – out of the egg came a tiny and very hungry caterpillar."

Direct from Off-Broadway, four beloved classics — “Brown Bear, Brown Bear”, “Mister Seahorse”, “The Very Lonely Firefly”, and “The Very Hungry Caterpillar” — leap off the page and on to the stage right in front of your eyes brought to life by a menagerie of 75 incredible puppets.

 

TOMÁS  AND THE LIBRARY LADY
April 25-May 19, 2019
By José Cruz González
Adapted from the book by Pat Mora

This production will be performed with sections of dialogue in Spanish and English with projected translations. 

"Libros, libros, libros I love to read. Libros, libros, libros that’s what I need."

Based on the true story of Mexican-American author and educator Tomás Rivera, this play, told in both Spanish and English, follows the son of migrant farm workers as he discovers a surprising world of possibility inside his local library thanks to a special librarian. This inspirational, theatrical biography proves that reading and respect can make anything possible.

name.text: GAP-Net Site Optimization Conference 2019 - Nashville, TN
name.html: GAP-Net Site Optimization Conference 2019 - Nashville, TN

description.text:
GAP-Net Site Optimization Conference 2019 - Nashville, TN
We are pleased to formally invite you to attend the 3rd Annual GAP-Net Site Optimization Conference which will be held in Nashville, TN from February 27th – March 1st, 2019. The meeting will again be focused on site-to-site and site-to-sponsor communication and will be held at the Nashville Marriott at Vanderbilt University. Please confirm your attendance through Eventbrite by January 11th, 2019. Please also email Megan Stephenson with any dietary restrictions, stephenson@globalalzplatform.org.
If you are interested in being a speaker, please contact Megan Stephenson, stephenson@globalalzplatform.org, with your preferred topic of interest as we will begin compiling a list of presenters and topics.  All speakers will be confirmed by GAP by the end of the year. Also, please note that GAP will pay for the travel cost of all speakers to attend the conference.

Schedule At-A-Glance
Wednesday, February 27th
Dinner Program at the Nashville Marriott at Vanderbilt University
2555 West End Ave, Nashville, TN 37203
*Dinner will be provided on-site
5:00 PM – 8:00 PM CT
 
Thursday, February 28th 
GAP-Net Site Optimization Conference, Nashville Marriott at Vanderbilt University
8:00 AM – 5:30 PM CT
Dinner – Location TBD
6:30 PM CT
 
Friday, March 1st
Optional Breakfast and Networking, Nashville Marriott at Vanderbilt University
8:00 AM – 11:00 AM CT
 

What GAP will Cover:
GAP will cover the cost for one (1) person per site to attend. If you are a speaker, GAP will cover the cost of your trip and your site will be responsible for covering the travel cost of additional team members (non-speakers) to attend.
 

Who Should Attend:
While all GAP-Net site personnel are welcome, this meeting targets our clinical operations site colleagues. As such, please share this invitation with those most appropriate to attend this event. Again, please complete your registration on Eventbrite by January 11th, 2019.
 

Meeting Location and Hotel Reservations:
Nashville Marriott at Vanderbilt University
2555 West End Ave, Nashville, TN 37203
Ph: (615) 321-1300
 

To reserve your hotel room, please follow this link to ensure you receive the negotiated room rate of $199/night (excluding taxes) https://book.passkey.com/e/49734980. You can also call the hotel direct at 800-285-0190 and mention that you are with the GAP-Net Site Optimization Conference. We have negotiated the room rates from February 26th – March 2nd, 2019 in case you need to arrive early because of travel or would like to extend your stay. With that said, GAP will only cover the cost of hotel rooms from 2/26 (if travel is an issue on 2/27) through March 1st (checking out). Please note that all hotel reservations must be made by December 14th, 2018 in order to receive the discounted rate.

description.text:
The B-52s play in the Presidential Ballroom at the Opryland Resort Sunday May 26th at 9pm. Doors for this performance are at 6pm for opening acts. Sunday only passes are needed if you're coming just for this headlining show. Weekender passes get you in to all events Thursday through Sunday, including the B-52s.
 
A celebration of Mid-Century America!  4 days, 5 stages, 80 performances, an outdoor car show, record hop, western fashion show, record convention, pool parties, pinup pageant, vintage slide show, and HUGE vintage vendor hall!
We expect the Opryland waterpark to be open by then. It is only available to guests staying at the resort.
Children under 9 and under free.
Get your hotel room now! We have a special discount rate but will sell out. 
All Thursday, Friday, Saturday & Sunday events included in ticket. Tickets are non-refundable. You can bring your children but ask that you keep them off the dance floors at night.  They must be supervised at all times.  The Nashville Palace does not allow children in the bars after 10pm.
 
This is a Muddy Roots Records event. Releases include: Sonny Burgess, Billy Harlan, Pat Reedy, The Sonics, Woody Pines, Wanda Jackson, Headcat, and more!

name.text: Pediatric Practice Management Conference- Nashville, TN
name.html: Pediatric Practice Management Conference- Nashville, TN

description.text:
Rooms at the Loews Hotel are sold out.  PMI recommends the following hotels that are within 2 blocks of the conference:
Hampton Inn Nashville/Vanderbilt
Courtyard by Marriott Nashville Vanderbilt/West
 
 

 
Click Here to Download Brochure (PDF)

 
Conference Description:
This conference is designed to provide participants with a better understanding of the nuances of operating a Pediatric Medical Practice. Through lecture, case studies and discussion, attendees will gain the knowledge necessary to ensure a successful Pediatric practice. 
Learning Objectives: After the conference, the attendees should have an understanding of the specific issues facing Pediatric medical practices. They will become aware of the special considerations related to financial reporting and operational design unique to Pediatrics. 
Who Should Attend: Pediatricians, Office Managers, Administrators, CFO, CIO, Revenue Cycle Managers, Decision Support Managers, Financial Leaders, IT Vendors and Clinical Managers.

This conference is designed to provide participants with a better understanding of the nuances of operating a Pediatric Medical Practice. Through lecture, case studies and discussion, attendees will gain the knowledge necessary to ensure a successful Pediatric practice.

Learning Objectives:
After the conference, the attendees should have an understanding of the specific issues facing Pediatric medical practices. They will become aware of the special considerations related to financial reporting and operational design unique to Pediatrics.

Who Should Attend:
Pediatricians, Office Managers, Administrators, CFO, CIO, Revenue Cycle Managers, Decision Support Managers, Financial Leaders, IT Vendors and Clinical Managers.

name.text: NYE 2019 LIVE: CHASE BRYANT PRIVATE CONCERT!
name.html: NYE 2019 LIVE: CHASE BRYANT PRIVATE CONCERT!

description.text:
SPECIAL PERFORMANCE : CHASE BRYANT LIVE! Pre Sale Tickets -$50

Join us for this one-night only private concert with limited tickets available! This intimate concert will be held on our third floor private event space which overlooks Cumberland River and Nissan Stadium.  

There will be two bars exclusive to this floor.  Your ticket entitles you to the other levels of entertainment (main floor and roof top)  as well as the private concert. You are free to move around the building and have full access to all of the evenings festivities at The George Jones.



FAQs

Are there ID or minimum age requirements to enter the event?
This is a 21+ event only. Guests must present a valid U.S. Driver's License or U.S. Passport to enter. Thank you!
Are there in and out privlidges?
Once you have entered the building with your ticket, you will be issued a wrist band if you decide to leave.  You must present your ticket, and wristband and ID (either Passport or valid Driver's License for reentry - NO EXCEPTIONS).  In past years, this has been a sold out event.  If the venue needs to hold the line at any time for safely reasons you may be denied re-entry!
Do we need to reserve specific seats?
This is an open floor with no seating - plenty of room to dance and two bars serving cocktails.  Doors open at 6pm.  Arrive early for closest proximity to stage. 
Is food available on this floor?
There is no food allowed/available on the concert floor.  The main floor and rooftop will offer menus during this event.
*****************************************************
Disclaimers:
No refunds or exchanges - rain or shine; all tickets/packages are non-refundable. The main floor, VIP area and rooftop  are ages 21+. Guests must present a valid U.S. Driver's License or U.S. Passport to enter main floor, rooftop and VIP areas. This is a 21+ Event.

name.text: HAZZARD COUNTY’S 40TH BIRTHDAY TO BE CELEBRATED IN NASHVILLE’S MUSIC VALLEY JANUARY 26TH 2019
name.html: HAZZARD COUNTY’S 40TH BIRTHDAY TO BE CELEBRATED IN NASHVILLE’S MUSIC VALLEY JANUARY 26TH 2019

description.text:
On January 26th, 1979, “The Dukes of Hazzard” premiered on CBS-Television as an unheraldedmid-season replacement. Now, 40 years later, the cast and fans of the show will join togetherin Nashville, Tennessee on Saturday, January 26, 2019 to celebrate “40 years of good times in Hazzard County”. Several events are planned, centered around “Cooter’s in Music City”, on McGavock Pike off Briley Parkway.The event will include “Meet and Greet plus pix and Autograph sessions” with cast members, a screening of the very first “Dukes” episode at The Troubadour Theatre, followed by a cast concert at The Nashville Palace, with Cooter’s Garage Band and very special guest Whey Jennings, the grandson of Waylon Jennings, who narrated “The Dukes” and wrote and sang the ever popular theme song, “Good Ol’ Boys”.
Cast members who plan to attend are Tom Wopat, who created the role of “Luke Duke”, Catherine Bach, known to the world as “Daisy Duke’, Sonny Shroyer, who played “Deputy Enos”, and Rick Hurst, who portrayed “Deputy Cletus”. Ben “Cooter” Jones and Alma Viator, the proprietors of “Cooter’s in Music City”, the Dukes of Hazzard Museum and shop on McGavock Pike, are hosting the shindig.
“The amazing thing about our show is that it seems as fresh and new as ever,” says Jones.“All over the world, folks watch the “Dukes” in different languages, and they watch it withtheir children. The kids who grew up watching it back in the early 80’s are watching it withtheir own kids now. And some of them are watching with their grandchildren! That’s the greatest complement our show could have.“When we first came on the air, the television critic for the Los Angeles Times said, “This showwon’t last past the first commercial break,” says Ben Jones, who played the sidekick mechanic“Cooter” on the show. “Just goes to show you, never pay attention to your critics!”

description.text:
Join Muddy Roots Music and the Tennessee Central Railway Museum on a day trip to the historic Mill in Lebanon, TN. Take an excursion train ride in a restored classic 1950s-era American streamlined stainless steel passenger train! Each ticket includes a wine tasting at the Mill, a catered meal, and live music. Passengers will have the opportunity to purchase additional wine at the Mill and each ticket includes a souvenir wine glass! Vintage dress is encourged but not required. Just have fun with it.







Seats are reserved and will be assigned by order of purchase with a follow up email 14 days from event. Passengers will be allowed to move around the train, but if you would like your group to sit together please purchase your tickets together and on the same card. Seats on train may face each other which puts you in a social scenario with other attendees. *Please see our FAQ page on our website: https://wineontherails.com/faqs/.




Event space is exclusive to train passengers.



REFRESHMENTS & SOUVENIRS


Souvenirs are available for purchase. Refreshments may be purchased in the diner car.





Vintage inspired attendants will serve you complimentary breakfast biscuits, artisan pastries, snacks and drinks.





GROUP SALES


For groups of 16 or more, please contact us at wineontherails@gmail.com








TIMES


Boarding: 10:30am at Tennessee Central Railway Museum


Departure: 11:00am SHARP to The Mill, Lebanon, TN.


Return: Approximately 6:00pm at Tennessee Central Railway Museum


Please arrive at the station by 10:00am.








TENNESSEE CENTRAL RAILWAY MUSEUM


220 Willow St, Nashville TN 37210








CLASSIC  CAR


Enjoy a ride through the serene countryside with friends and loved ones. Comfortable coach accommodations, featuring spacious, reclining seats with windows up to 5 feet wide on both sides of the car. The perfect getaway. 








DOME SEATING


The ultimate panoramic view from the train is from the 20 seats in the ex-Northern Pacific Ry Dome coach car. Ride in spacious, cushioned seats in a glass-enclosed dome above the roofline from the rest of the train to experience unobstructed 360-degree views of the beautiful Tennessee countryside. Personal attendant comes through to assist. Only 20 seats are available, so make your reservations extra early, as these seats always sell out first! 





Passengers in wheelchairs, please contact Terry Bebout at the Tennessee Central Railway Museum ticket office for special arrangements. 615-244-9001 x4 or email tbebout@nerr.com








TERMS & CONDITIONS





***No refunds for any reason.*** Tickets are transferrable to other people, but not to other events. Must be 21 years old or older to ride the train.





Diner car is available on train once rolling. The winery brings in a food truck as well.





Wine on the Rails FAQs 


https://wineontherails.com/faqs/





Wine on the Rails is a Muddy Roots Music event.





***No refunds for any reason.***

description.text: The Second Annual Innovations in Invasive Species Management Conference and Workshop brings together both novice and professional land managers from throughout the US.  The meeting will be co-hosted by Invasive Plant Control, Inc., the National Military Fish and Wildlife Association's Invasive Species Working Group, the Tennessee Invasive Plant Council, the Mid Atalantic Invasive Plant Council and the Pacific Northwest invasive Plant Council.    Abstracts are currently being accepted.   In 2017 tickets sold out and in 2018 we have a capacity of 230 so we suggest purchasing your tickets soon.

name.text: East Nashville Beer Festival presented by 3 Crow Bar
name.html: East Nashville Beer Festival presented by 3 Crow Bar

description.text:
The Annual East Nashville Beer Festival presented by 3 Crow Bar returns on Saturday, April 13, 2019! For 2019 you can expect some big changes, including an all-inclusive VIP ticket option that will have food, special beers, and a private lounge area. Guests can also expect several out of market breweries to be joining us!
FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS
What are the hours of the festival and when is it?April 13, 2019-Gates open at 12 pm and we will begin scanning tickets at 11 am. Event ends at 5 pm. 
What does the festival Cost?$60, which includes entry to the festival, 5-ounce tasting glass, and samples of all beers.  VIP ticket information coming soon. Will there be designated driver tickets?Yes, they will be $20 and you still must be 21+. You will not receive a tasting glass. However, snacks and soda will be provided. You can find these snacks near the entrance/exit.
Do you have to be over the age of 21 to attend?Yes, no exceptions all ID`s will be checked at the gate. Please don’t bother to buy a ticket if you are not 21.
Are children allowed at the event?Sorry, no children. Call the babysitter in advance!
Are pets allowed at the event?As much as we love our dogs, cats, goats, and fish, please leave them at home.
What happens if it rains or snows?The show must go on. Rain, snow or shine, no refunds. You remember the snow of 2018, right.
Will there be food at the event?Yes, food will be sold by some of the best food trucks in town.
Will there be bathrooms at the event?Yes, hand wash stations too, plus a boatload of port o potties! You can be certain you will not wait in line.

name.text: A Jazzy Christmas On The Cumberland
name.html: A Jazzy Christmas On The Cumberland

description.text:
A Jazzy Christmas On The Cumberland is our 3rd annual Elegant Evening of Live Concerts, Fine Dining, Dancing, and Cruising aboard the General Jackson Showboat at Opryland, 5pm-9pm. 
Headlining the Main Stage in the 2 Story Victorian Theater will be Marcus L. Wilson and Friends featuring National Recording Artist Cole Robb playing the best in Jazz, Blues, Motown and Holiday Favorites. The Ben GriegoQuartet, Ruth Ann Conley Quartet, and Fredrick Weathersby will be our show openers to serenade the cozy Heritage Hall on the upper deck, with a Breathtaking Panoramic View. Plus, we have a Spacious Dance Floor To Get Your Groove On, and a few other surprises and giveaways. 
Your All Access Experience includes a Delicious 3 Course Meal, with 3 Live Shows, and a Scenic 3 Hour Holiday Cruise down the Cumberland River. Our Nature Cruise takes us through Sprawling Hillsides to the Bright City Lights of Downtown Nashville.   
Dinner Includes: Salad / 2 Entress and 2 Sides, Breads / Desserts / Water, Tea, Coffee (Alcoholic Beverages Sold Separately) 
Reserve A Table: To Ensure Group Seating For Your  Date Night, Family Gathering, Company Chsristmas Party, and Just Hanging With Friends For the Holidays (Seats Up To 8 People) otherwise, Open Seating  (All Reserved Tables Recieve Express Check In)
             Limited Early Bird Tickets: Singles $75 / Couples $145  
                                      General Admission Tickets: Singles $85 / Couple $155
______________________________________________________________________________________________________
Time: Boarding Strictly Between 5:00pm-6:00pm / Depart Dock Promptly at 6:00pm for Concerts, Dinner, Dancing, and Cruise / Return to Dock 9:00pm 
Boarding Pass: ARRIVE EARLY DUE TO HOLIDAY TRAFFIC / Bring PRINTED TICKETS For Express Check In
A Jazzy Christmas on the Cumberland helps support numerous non profit groups: Excellence In Motion, Inc. S.T.E.A.M (Science, Technology, Engineering, Arts, Math) for Youth. Feeding Families for the Holidays and Beyond. Metro Youth Continuing Music Education. Please Puchase of our Limited Edition Jazz On The Cumberland Hat, T-shirt, Jazz or Christmas CD, plus receive an added Gift for Only $35.00 per person. Portion of proceeds benefit these groups.

description.html:
A Jazzy Christmas On The Cumberland is our 3rd annual Elegant Evening of Live Concerts, Fine Dining, Dancing, and Cruising aboard the General Jackson Showboat at Opryland, 5pm-9pm. 

Headlining the Main Stage in the 2 Story Victorian Theater will be Marcus L. Wilson and Friends featuring National Recording Artist Cole Robb playing the best in Jazz, Blues, Motown and Holiday Favorites. The Ben GriegoQuartet, Ruth Ann Conley Quartet, and Fredrick Weathersby will be our show openers to serenade the cozy Heritage Hall on the upper deck, with a Breathtaking Panoramic View. Plus, we have a Spacious Dance Floor To Get Your Groove On, and a few other surprises and giveaways. 

Your All Access Experience includes a Delicious 3 Course Meal, with 3 Live Shows, and a Scenic 3 Hour Holiday Cruise down the Cumberland River. Our Nature Cruise takes us through Sprawling Hillsides to the Bright City Lights of Downtown Nashville.   

Dinner Includes: Salad / 2 Entress and 2 Sides, Breads / Desserts / Water, Tea, Coffee (Alcoholic Beverages Sold Separately) 

Reserve A Table: To Ensure Group Seating For Your  Date Night, Family Gathering, Company Chsristmas Party, and Just Hanging With Friends For the Holidays (Seats Up To 8 People) otherwise, Open Seating  (All Reserved Tables Recieve Express Check In)

             Limited Early Bird Tickets: Singles $75 / Couples $145  

                                      General Admission Tickets: Singles $85 / Couple $155

______________________________________________________________________________________________________

Time: Boarding Strictly Between 5:00pm-6:00pm / Depart Dock Promptly at 6:00pm for Concerts, Dinner, Dancing, and Cruise / Return to Dock 9:00pm 

Boarding Pass: ARRIVE EARLY DUE TO HOLIDAY TRAFFIC / Bring PRINTED TICKETS For Express Check In

A Jazzy Christmas on the Cumberland helps support numerous non profit groups: Excellence In Motion, Inc. S.T.E.A.M (Science, Technology, Engineering, Arts, Math) for Youth. Feeding Families for the Holidays and Beyond. Metro Youth Continuing Music Education. Please Puchase of our Limited Edition Jazz On The Cumberland Hat, T-shirt, Jazz or Christmas CD, plus receive an added Gift for Only $35.00 per person. Portion of proceeds benefit these groups.  

Info: www.jazzonthecumberland.com / jazzonthecumberland@gmail.com / 615-731-9001


Presented By: Victor Chatman Productions and the General Jackson Showboat at Opryland

description.text:
The W.O. Smith Junior Advisory Board & The Phoenix Club are excited to present Nashville’s premiere 2018 New Year’s Eve party. Last year's event sold out well before New Year's Eve, and we're making the necessary improvements to ensure that this year's event is bigger and better!

***THIS IS AN ALL INCLUSIVE EVENT***

Fire Ball NYE 2018 promises to Ignite the Night. Live music from BandLux & DJ Benji under the tent will make this an event you don't want to miss. Hors d'oeuvres provided by Fresh Hospitality (Taziki's, et. al.) will be served throughout the evening. At midnight, The Party Fowl Nashville Breakfast Buffet will open to cure any late night cravings. And Tin Can Photos will be there snapping pics in an old school VW Bus.

DrinkMusicCity.com guarantees to create a winter cocktail wonderland including:

Top Shelf Open Bar
Plenty of Fireball
Muisc City Light & other Local Craft Beer
Pennington Distillery Amazingness
ENDLESS BUBBLES ALL NIGHT LONG

Tickets are available for $150, while supplies last, so make sure you buy your tickets early. All proceeds will benefit the W.O. Smith Community Music School and The Phoenix Club.

Courtesy Shuttle from W.O. Smith Music School to Midtown, Gulch, and Hillsboro Village complimentary - Shuttle service runs from 10:30PM - 2:00AM
- Black Tie Optional -

** 21 and UP ONLY**

About the School: Since 1984, W.O. Smith Music School has been providing music lessons to low-income households for 50 cents a lesson. Starting from humble grounds with a mere 45 students, W.O. Smith has grown tremendously to support over 400 students today.  In spite of its low-overhead and volunteer faculty, the W.O. Smith Music School must still raise funds to cover its annual administrative and operational expenses. It relies on fund raising events, foundation and corporate grants, and contributions from individual supporters.

About the Phoenix Club: The Phoenix Club of Nashville (PCON) strive to provide a funding mechanism to help alter the course of our disadvantaged youth while developing lasting friendships in the young professional ranks of Middle Tennessee. The club raises money in a manner that challenges members to reach out into the community for funds that enable our disadvantaged youth to prosper. The Phoenix Club is a dynamic cross section of young professionals.
Donations

description.text:
It’s that time of year again. We’re all bundling up and counting down the days until all of the best holiday celebrations arrive. You’ll want to put the TN HIMSS Holiday Reception, our most popular event of the year, on the top of your list. After a year jam-packed year with knowledge-sharing, networking and old-fashioned hard work, we’ve all earned a night off to celebrate the season. Our holiday reception is the place to enjoy some holiday cheer with your fellow members and colleagues in the industry. It’s also a great way to network by connecting with old friends and new. If your New Year’s resolution involves making a career move in 2019, or just advancing your industry knowledge, be sure to join us and RSVP today!
Sponsorships are avaialble - please contact Tiffany@tnhimss.org for more information.
Thank you to our Sponsors!

description.text:
The Bridge To Christmas Toyland is an event put on by one of our Community Ministry Partners, The Bridge Ministry!
Each year, New Song has the opportunity to partner with the Bridge in a couple of ways. The first way we get to help is by providing unwrapped toys for Toyland- a fun Christmas experience for kids complete with toys for all the kids, lots of candy, and fun characters including Santa!
If you have any questions regarding this event, or anything related to The Bridge Ministry, please email Pastor Donna Phillips at dphillips@newsongnashville.com!
**Because of the nature of this serving opportunity, we ask that only children age FOUR and older join you as you help.**
PRAYER & ORIENTATION-Please arrive at the site early to be a part of prayer and a brief orientation for the night at 5 p.m. so that all volunteers can be in place by 5:30 p.m. ready to serve.

description.text:
BHS Midwinter Convention 2019 All Chapter Chorus Registration
Greg Clancy, director
The All Chapter Chorus is about giving our convention attendees a chance to get out of the chair and onto the stage.  The thrill of performing in a large chorus, with other men who have prepared music ahead of time, being directed by a gold medal chorus director, for three short rehearsals, is both thrilling and fun.
After registering through Eventbrite, music and tracks will be provided for this year's songs: 


My Honey's Lovin' Arms (arr. Don Gray)


Little Pal (arr. Lou Perry)


Yes Indeed (arr. Earl Moon)


Rehearsal Schedule:
Opryland, Governor’s Ballroom D
Thursday, January 24
6 pm - 7:30 pm (right before the Thursday night show)
Friday, January 2510 pm - 11:30 pm (Right AFTER the chorus festival - no hard stop) 
Saturday, January 266 pm - 7:15 pm (right before the Saturday night show)
Show Performance:                                                                                                                                                  Grand Ole Opry House 7:30 pm (sing first on the show)
For questions, comments or concerns, please contact harmonyu@barbershop.org

description.text:
Nashville's only private club on the top floor of a downtown high-rise is at it again! Bringing you the hottest party in Nashville for the eighth consecutive year, the Nashville City Club's "Havana Nights"  themed evening will not disappoint! You do not need to be a member to attend this event. Our newly remodeled location is on the 20th floor of the ServiceSource building, on the corner of 4th and Church, just a few blocks away from the Honky Tonks on Broadway and Historic Printers Alley, guests will enjoy a panoramic view of downtown Nashville while sampling the City Club's finest hors d'oeuvres, live music and libations. This year we have added additional bars so attendees will have easier access to libations without long lines. For one, all-inclusive price, each guest will receive entry to an open premium bar, hearty hors d'oeuvres buffet, multiple rooms of entertainment including Live Music and DJ Stretch, complimentary coat check, party favors and a champagne toast at midnight!
Limited number of early Bird tix $125 (SOLD OUT) then price increases to $150 & $175-Very Limited tickets available at each price point so purchase your tickets now! Once you purchase your ticket, your first and last name will be added to a guest list. At the door, security will check your I.D, and match your name to the name on the guest list. When buying a ticket, please submit the name on your valid I.D. All group tickets purchased will require all attendees be present with original ticket purchaser at check-in with I.D.s 
***THIS IS AN ALL INCLUSIVE EVENT***
Frequently Asked Questions:
Tickets are non-refundable
Tickets are non-transferrable 
You must be at least 21 years of age to enter the event. No one under 21 will be admitted so please do not buy tickets as there are no refunds. You must bring a valid ID with photo. Without a picture ID to show proof of being legal age, no entry, no exceptions.
No re-entry once exiting the building
Coat check is complimentary for all guests, however we are not responsible for lost or stolen itemsPremium open bar includes domestic beer, red and white wine, champagne/prosecco and premium liquor
We enforce responsible alcohol service any person deemed intoxicated beyond legal limits will be asked to leave the event with efforts made for a “safe ride”.
No parking available for this event
Items subject to change and prices will increase as the event nears.

description.text:
BLISSDOM IS A CONFERENCE AND A COMMUNITY WHO WANT TO TAKE THEIR BUSINESS AND LIFE TO THE NEXT LEVEL.
Blissdom has always been the launching point of so many successful businesses, friendships, the place where dreams are born, and strategies are developed.
The Blissdom community includes New York Times Best Selling authors, speakers, TV show hosts, marketers, podcasters along with online entrepreneurs working off a laptop while in the back yard with the kids, and those just dipping their toes in the water of online business. 
You have a place here. You have a dream and you need two things: community and knowledge. Blissdom will give you both. 
At Blissdom you will connect with the people you need in your corner and connect with the brands and partners who will take your work to the next level. 
Spend a few days with us in Nashville and learn the details you need to take your business and your dream to the next level. 
Find out more at BlissdomConference.com
FAQs can be found here.

description.text:
Meet all the Princesses at The Nashville Fairytale Ball. This magical event is full of memorable moments you won't want to miss! Dance with Cinderella. Read with Rapunzel. Share Sweet Treats with Tinkerbell. Create a Tiara with The Little Mermaid! All of our princesses are excited to sing, dance, and play with your little ones! Our event focuses on making sure your little one feels royal throughout all of our activities.This event includes professional princess portraits for every child, candy buffet, crafts, stories, songs, games, and more. Tickets for this event always sell out- so we suggest you get your tickets soon!
VIP Tickets: Enjoy a full extra hour with all the princesses! We will do pictures, face painting, pixie wishes, enjoy sweet treats, stories, dance lessons and more with our Fairytale Friends during this enchanted social hour before the Fairytale Ball.Fairytale Tickets: A ticket to the Fairytale Ball includes so many magical things - a Royal Entrance, Group Games, Ocean Yoga, Princess Crafts, Candy Buffet, Stories, and Sing-A-Longs, Princess Performances, Professional Portraits, and MORE!More Information can be found HERE:PrettyPrincessPartiesMN.com

description.text: Join harpist/songwriter Timbre for her beautiful Christmas show, featuring her band, strings &  brass, and special guests SONUS choir!

description.text:
What happens when you put four singer-songwriters into a studio for four months that have never met? Music City history is made! Join us for our special Creatives Day-Analog Musicians Showcase Series featuring Micah Redd, Roz, Chuck Indigo and Trisha Alicia! 
These amazing artists have been working for months on brand new music that they are ready to share in an incredbile live performance. Admission is free, but seating is limited. Reserve your seat now. 
DOORS: 7:00 pm / SHOW: 7:30 pm

description.text:
We'll bring the booze, you bring the Christmas cheer.
Help the FoxFuel family celebrate our new home on historic Music Row with a Holiday Housewarming. Sure, you can bring us presents.

P.S. We're cutting a giant ribbon with giant scissors at 4 if you wanna pregame in a big way.

description.text:
It's the most wonderful time of the year!! 
Come celebrate the most wonderful time of the year with AMA Nashville. Join members and non-members for a fun night of food, drinks, and music!
Sponsored by:  

We've partnered with Lyft to offer exclusive ride discounts!





New to Lyft?: Get $5 off 2 rides at http://lyft.com/i/amanash or download the app and enter code AMANASH.





Already Have Lyft?: Save 10% off 2 rides to or from the AMA Nashville event with code AMA1211.
